title: Addition
shortDescription: Addition is the foundation of all mathematics. Children learn to combine quantities and understand the concept of 'more'.
importance: Addition is the first operation children learn and is the basis for all other arithmetic operations. Mastery of addition is needed for shopping, money management, measurements, and more.
howToTeach: Start with tangible objects - blocks, pencils, candies
Explain that 'addition' is like 'adding' or 'collecting together'
Practice first with small numbers (up to 10)
When the child is ready, introduce carrying (regrouping) gradually
Use a number line as a visual aid

examples.explanation: Start from 7, count 5 more: 8, 9, 10, 11, 12. Or: 7 + 3 = 10, plus 2 more = 12.

commonMistakes: Forgetting to carry - when units exceed 10
Errors in digit order when writing vertically
parentTips: Don't rush - give the child time to think
Encourage using fingers at the beginning - that's okay!
Turn practice into a game: 'I have 3 apples, you give me 4 more, how many do we have?'
